intro: Colymbada parnonia, commonly known as the Parnon mountain bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Colymbada parnonia is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
